item.title: Zenless Zone Zero- Officer Mewmew Missions In Lumina Square
item.description:
Zenless Zone Zero has multiple occasions in the game for players to earn rewards. One of them is the Officer Mewmew missions in the area. Once players unlock Lumina Square after finishing Main Quest Chapter 2- Interlude, then only will they gain access to Officer Mewmew.

Officer Mewmew will navigate you to the first quest in the medal mission. You can find him opposite the Public Sector Police Station for the rest of the medals. Each medal can only be obtained across various time periods in the day, so make sure to keep an eye on the time, otherwise you might miss it. Furthermore, the missions are rather random and cannot be obtained in any particular order, so it's best to always check the district details for any active missions around, than have to miss them and wait.

Lumina Square Mewmew Medals Page 1

Medal Mission Location How To Complete
Keen Senses Medal Find all the missing cargo trucks. Around Lumina Square This mission is pretty easy since players just have to run around the area and find all the cargo trucks.
Kind Helper Medal I Complete the mission “It’s Hard to Find a Job, It’s Hard to Be a Bangboo” Anytime: In front of HIA Club Find the Bangboo KK and follow the storyline. You’ll have to go with the Bangboo to various stores around Lumina Square.
Kind Helper Medal II Complete the mission “It’s Hard to Find a Sidekick, It’s Hard to Be a Cat” Daytime (Morning or Afternoon): Near the O-Fish Supplies building Find KK beside two cats near the O-Fish Supplies building. Interact with him to complete the mission.
Kind Helper Medal III Complete the mission “Big City, Little Ones” Daytime (Morning): Beside the HIA Club Find Mei near the large red landmark and speak to her to start the quest. The mission will take the whole day and finish in the evening, so make sure to plan your schedule well.
Kind Helper Medal IV Complete the mission “Riddlers’ Club - Part 1” Daytime (Morning): Under the Palm Tree , opposite the newsstand Find an NPC called Sam and interact with him to solve the riddle and the first mission.
Kind Helper Medal V Complete the mission “Riddlers’ Club - Part 2” Daytime (Morning): Under the Palm Tree , opposite the newsstand Find the NPC Sam again and interact with him to successfully solve the next riddle.
Kind Helper Medal VI Complete the mission “Riddlers’ Club - Part 3” Daytime (Morning): In front of Galaxy Cinema Find an elderly NPC called ‘Curious Passerby’. Interact with her, and she will lead you to find a Bangboo called MarcelBB07. Interact with the Bangboo who is under the palm tree and complete the quest.
Chivalrous Spirit Medal I Help a Bangboo Daytime (Morning): Outside Galaxy Cinema Find One-Dennyboo surrounded by a group of teenagers and rescue him.
Chivalrous Spirit Medal II Help a Bangboo Daytime (Afternoon): Coff Café, 2nd Floor Head to Coff Café and head up the stairs to your right. You’ll find Anxietyboo with a target on its head looking at the horizon. Talk to it to help it.
Chivalrous Spirit Medal III Help a Bangboo Daytime (Evening): Across the street from the Police Station/ Opposite HIA Club Find Complaintboo in a penguin outfit and talk to it to complete the mission.
Chivalrous Spirit Medal IV Help a Bangboo Nighttime (Midnight): Behind the newsstand Find Treasure Hunt Bangboo and help it get its treasure back from the dog.
Timely Assistance Medal I Help a Bangboo Nighttime (Midnight): Children's Park
  1. Head to the park behind all the restaurants and find Scientist Bangboo.
  2. Rotate the top left socket once
  3. Rotate the bottom middle socket twice so that it can unlock the bottom right socket
  4. Once the socket is unlocked, rotate the bottom middle socket thrice
  5. Then, rotate the bottom left socket thrice as well . This will connect the middle line
  6. You only need to rotate the middle right socket to complete the module.
Timely Assistance Medal II Help a Bangboo Daytime (Morning): Near the Public Security Building
  1. Find the Transforming Bangboo and help fix it.
  2. Rotate the bottom left socket thrice , the bottom middle once , and the bottom right thrice
  3. Once the middle socket unlocks , rotate it once
  4. Then, rotate the middle right and top right yellow socket once
  5. Lastly, rotate the middle left socket twice to complete
Timely Assistance Medal III Help a Bangboo Daytime (Afternoon): Outside the Public Security Building near the overhead crossing
  1. Head to the bike stand and find the Unconscious Justaboo near some bicycles.
  2. Rotate the topmost yellow socket once
  3. Rotate the bottom left socket twice
  4. Then, the bottom middle socket twice and lastly, the bottom right socket twice
Timely Assistance Medal IV Help a Bangboo Daytime (Evening): Opposite Chop Junior’s Shop near the bus station
  1. Find a broken Bangboo called Curled Up Bangboo and help fix it.
  2. Rotate the top left socket thrice
  3. Rotate the center socket twice
  4. Then, rotate the bottom left blue socket twice and the bottom right blue socket once to complete.
Silver Talent Seeker Medal Collect 8 HIA Coins in Lumina Square Anytime Players only need to collect half of the HIA Coins around the area.

item.title: Elden Ring: 14 Best Female Characters
item.description:
Highlights

  • The narrative of Elden Ring is rich, with intriguing characters like Queen Marika shaping the journey.
  • Diverse female characters like Millicent and Hyetta add depth and mystery to the game's storyline.
  • Characters like Sorceress Sellen and Rennala offer complex quests and tragic backstories for players to explore.

The narrative of Elden Ring is deep and rich, from the expansive worldbuilding to the epic stakes of the Tarnished's quest. One of the places where this narrative shines through the most is in its characters. The Lands Between are populated with deep, fascinating figures, whose decisions and motivations will leave a profound impact on the Tarnished's journey to rebuild the Elden Ring.

From intimidating bosses to close allies, Elden Ring is home to some truly fascinating female characters. Some of these women come to life in intricate questlines, while others are major historical figures, whose legacy can only be learned through item descriptions and flavor text. Here are some of the most memorable female characters in Elden Ring .

Updated July 17th, 2024, by Peter Morics: Elden Ring's recent DLC, Shadow of the Erdtree, added an expansive new region that's rich in content and lore. Players have been learning a lot about the backstory of the Golden Order and the living gods that have shaped this region's grim history. They've also been meeting some very significant new characters. The DLC includes several new female characters who have more than earned their place among the legendary figures from the base game. These characters include stalwart new allies, challenging new bosses, and figures with startling revelations to share about the nature of Elden Ring's world itself, and they are now included on this list with its latest update.

14 Rellana, Twin Moon Knight

An Enigmatic And Challenging Foe

  • Location: Castle Ensis, Castle Lord's Chamber Site of Grace

While Shadow of the Erdtree takes players to a new realm with new lore and people, the major factions from the Lands Between still have an undeniable presence. This can especially be seen in Rellana , a Carian noblewoman who forsook her noble destiny to aid Messmer in his campaign of destruction against the Hornsent.

The complex history of this mysterious figure can be teased out through item descriptions, but first, players will have to fight her. Rellana is absolutely brutal in combat, wielding a fearsome dual-blade technique that calls back to legendary bosses from past FromSoftware games like Bloodborne 's Lady Maria and Dark Souls 3 's Pontiff Sulyvahn.

13 Metyr, Mother of Fingers

A Key Piece Of The Game's Lore Puzzle

  • Location: Finger Ruins of Miyr, Cathedral of Manus Metyr Site of Grace

Much of Elden Ring 's lore concerns the strange eldritch Outer Gods that meddle in the affairs of The Lands Between from beyond. These beings are often key to the most mysterious aspects of the game's lore, and they're very rarely encountered in person. Metyr, the Mother of Fingers , is a significant exception to this.

This sinister and grotesque DLC boss is one of the most significant figures in the game's history and cosmology, as she provides important context for the Two Fingers and their twisted role in Elden Ring 's central religion. The sidequest required to reach her contains important and disturbing revelations about the game's entire cosmology.

12 Redmane Freyja

A Proud Knight With Important Secrets

  • Location: Gravesite Plain, Three-Paths Cross Site Of Grace

The stalwart warrior Redmane Freyja is one of the first friendly NPCs most players will meet upon arrival in the Realm of Shadow. This proud knight fought alongside General Radahn, but was stricken with Scarlet Rot and left for dead. Miquella saved her and cured her affliction, giving her a second chance in life and causing her to swear her fealty to the enigmatic demigod.

Freyja can aid the Tarnished with a couple of the DLC's dangerous and deadly bosses. As her sidequest progresses, she and the Tarnished will both learn some key bits of ancient lore concerning the relationship between Miquella and Radahn. While her fellow followers of Miquella are doomed to a tragic end, her aid remains invaluable while she and the Tarnished remain on the same side.

11 Needle Knight Leda

A Zealous Follower Of Miquella The Kind

  • Location: Mohgwyn Palace, Cocoon of the Empyrean Site of Grace

Needle Knight Leda is one of the most prominent NPCs in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC. She leads Miquella's band of followers across the war-torn region, seeking to serve their lord in his ascent to godhood. While she starts as a friendly NPC, and even aids the Tarnished against Rellana, the Twin Moon Knight, her zealotry and fanaticism never fade, and when Miquella's enchantment begins to fade from her allies, her true nature springs forth.

Leda's undying devotion to Miquella provides the Tarnished with a chilling look at the sort of world the demigod might create if he's allowed to ascend to godhood. The inevitable but tragic conclusion of her deadly crusade culminates in a bitter and brutal standoff that sees the bonds of loyalty and camaraderie pushed to the absolute limit.

10 Queen Marika

The Enigmatic Goddess Within The Erdtree

  • Location: The Erdtree

Queen Marika the Eternal is arguably the most important character in Elden Ring . This divine figure conquered the Lands Between in ages long past and imposed her religion, the Golden Order, on the entire land. Her machinations set most of the events of the game into motion. When the Tarnished returns to the Lands Between, it's in chaos because Queen Marika shattered the Elden Ring which imposed order on the realm. She subsequently vanished, disappearing deep within the Erdtree.

In addition to being one of the most influential characters in Elden Ring , Queen Marika is also one of the most inscrutable. Her largely unknown motivations for shattering the Elden Ring and banishing the Tarnished are a point of considerable discussion and speculation among fans and Elden Ring characters alike.

9 Millicent

A Diseased Warrior With Great Potential

  • Location: Church of the Plague

Millicent's questline starts innocently enough. A sage asks the Tarnished for help procuring a gold needle that he believes will aid Millicent in her struggle with the Scarlet Rot, a deadly affliction which is present throughout the Lands Between. Once the needle is obtained and repaired, Millicent begins a journey across the Lands Between in order to confront her past.

As it turns out, this past is more sinister than it appears. Millicent is descended from Malenia herself, the source of the Scarlet Rot and the manifestation of its divinity. Gowry, the kindly sage who helped cure her in the first place, actually wishes to see the Scarlet Rot flourish in her and bloom, just as it has in Malenia. The Tarnished is faced with a choice to aid Millicent on her journey or betray her, furthering the goals of the cult of rot.

8 Hyetta

A Mysterious And Sinister Maiden

  • Location: Liurnia of the Lakes, Lake-Facing Cliffs Site Of Grace

One of the most important aspects of Elden Ring is that the Greater Will, as represented by the Golden Order, is far from the only divine force meddling in the Lands Between. This is where Hyetta comes in. When the Tarnished first meets this kindly blind woman, she claims she is a humble Finger Maiden in search of a golden light. The fact that her journey requires a steady supply of Shabriri Grapes, which are diseased eyeballs, suggests that her quest isn't quite as innocent as the Tarnished, and maybe even Hyetta, may have been led to believe.

Hyetta's questline is one of the most sinister stories in the game, and a lot of it revolves around how strange she is as a character. Her uncanny resemblance to a different blind woman encountered earlier in the game leads some fans to speculate that Hyetta isn't a person at all and that the body is simply a puppet for the malign force of the Frenzied Flame. This mystery, and the horrifying implications it has for the Lands Between, make Hyetta a truly compelling character.

7 Sorceress Sellen

A Cunning Witch With A Checkered Past

  • Location: Waypoint Ruins

Sellen can be encountered fairly early on in Elden Ring . Spellcasting Tarnished will make good use of her, as she sells a good variety of Glinstone Sorceries. Like many other spell merchants, her inventory can even be expanded if she's given more spellbooks found throughout the Tarnished's travels.

However, Sellen's story goes far beyond simply acting as a spell vendor. She's the center of a long and complex questline that will take the Tarnished all over the Lands Between. Pursuing this quest will teach the player about Sellen's past as a sinister figure known as the Graven Witch. It also exposes some of the darkest secrets of the academy of Raya Lucaria and the nature of Glintstone Sorcery itself.

6 Nepheli Loux

A Warrior Destined For Greatness

  • Location: Stormveil Castle, Secluded Cell Site of Grace

While Elden Ring is a very open-ended game, most players will find themselves visiting Stormveil Castle as their first major dungeon. It is here one can meet Nepheli Loux , a powerful warrior who is here to dethrone Godrick the Grafted. Nepheli can be summoned to help take down the monstrous lord, and her assistance in combat is invaluable. Her proper questline only begins after Godrick falls.

As the Tarnished befriends and accompanies Nepheli they will see some of the darkest corners of the Lands Between. Nepheli's personal journey exposes her to corruption, manipulation, and atrocities. The player can either help her keep her resolve in the face of utter darkness or take advantage of her for personal gain. Aiding Nepheli helps her develop into a truly noble lord, who will rule over Limgrave with wisdom and justice.

5 Rennala, Queen Of The Full Moon

The Tragic Queen Of Raya Lucaria

  • Location: Raya Lucaria Grand Library

Rennala is one of the five shardbearers players can challenge for a piece of the Elden Ring, and she's also one of the most tragic. As the leader of the Carian Royal Family, Rennala led her Academy against the Golden Order, in a series of brutal wars that only ended when she fell in love with the Order's champion, Radagon. When Radagon abandoned her, her sorrow led to the collapse of Raya Lucaria, once one of the strongest factions in the realm.

By the time the Tarnished confronts her, she's become delusional, obsessed with rebirthing her scholars using the mystical Golden Egg Radagon gave her before he left. During the fight, the player must battle not only Rennala, but an illusion of the sorceress queen, representing Rennala at the height of her power. The stark contrast between these two forms highlights just how heartbreaking Rennala's descent truly is.

4 Roderika

The Kind Spirit Tuner

  • Location: Stormhill Shack

Roderika's adventure in the Lands Between came to an abrupt and horrifying end when her soldiers were grafted onto Godrick's minions in Stormveil Castle. When the Tarnished finds her, she is despondent and traumatized, and she will swiftly flee to the Roundtable Hold once she's given a measure of comfort about her fallen friends.

Roderika's storyline involves her coming to terms with her perceived failure at Stormveil Castle. With encouragement from the player, she eventually flourishes as a spirit tuner, allowing her to upgrade spirit ashes. This function makes her indispensable to the Tarnished, but seeing this kind young woman recover from her trauma and strive to do right by her allies is arguably the greater reward.

3 Melina

A Mysterious Makeshift Maiden

  • Location: Third Site Of Grace Found

The enigmatic Melina is a very prominent character who acts as the Tarnished's companion throughout the game. Since the Tarnished lacks a Maiden to help them channel runes into strength, Melina fills that role, making her extremely important from a gameplay perspective. Melina's origins are murky, but she wishes to reach the Erdtree to learn more about who she is and what her purpose is.

The Tarnished's bond with Melina grows over the course of the game, but the mystery surrounding her deepens as well. As a likely daughter of Queen Marika herself, Melina's status in the world of the Lands Between is deeply significant, and this makes her apparent anonymity all the more surprising. While speculation runs rampant about some of the more elusive details of her backstory, her steadfast bond with the Tarnished and her determination to enter the Erdtree make her a truly remarkable companion.

2 Malenia, Blade Of Miquella

The Undefeated Goddess Of Rot

  • Location: Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree

Malenia is one of the most famous boss fights in Elden Ring . Despite being buried deep in the hidden location of the Haligree, her impact on the Lands Between is palpable. Her famous battle with the legendary Starscourge Radahn blanketed much of the land in Scarlet Rot, which continues to fester and spread to this day.

As a demigoddess and Empyrean, Malenia is a candidate for godhood and a potential ruler of the Lands Between, which makes her affliction with the Scarlet Rot all the more alarming. It also makes her backstory more impressive. Malenia is motivated primarily by a deep, abiding love for her sibling Miquella, and much of the training that made her such a peerless fighter was dedicated to locking away the Scarlet Rot that roils within her. Malenia is truly a legendary figure, and fighting her appropriately feels like crossing blades with a deity.

1 Ranni The Witch

A Secretive Demigod

  • Location: Ranni's Rise

The elusive Ranni the Witch lies at the center of one of Elden Ring 's longest and most involved questlines. Players who follow her story eventually learn that she is a descendant of Rennala and Radagon, a demigod who is fit to inherit lordship over the Lands Between. However, Ranni actively defies her fate, casting away her body and rejecting the guidance of the Two Fingers.

By allying with Ranni, the Tarnished can aid her in steering her own destiny, forcing the stars into motion and orchestrating the death of the godly Two Fingers. Her determination and her secretive nature make Ranni a deeply compelling character, and her ending, which sees the player become Ranni's consort and lead the world into a new age of mystery and discovery, is one of the game's most popular.

item.title: Fallout Fan Makes Interesting Find on Facebook Marketplace
item.description:
Highlights

  • A gamer discovers a Fallout 3 Power Armor statue on Facebook Marketplace, which is being offered for free.
  • The Fallout 3 Power Armor statue may not be as free as it seems, as sellers may add a price later on.
  • With the popularity of Fallout games on the rise, some collectors are seeking out rare merchandise.

A Fallout fan has come across a promotional Fallout 3 Brotherhood of Steel statue when browsing Facebook Marketplace. Game stores are known for having large displays promoting a franchise, and this Fallout statue may be coveted by new and old fans alike.

Since the first season of the Fallout Amazon Prime Video series was released, Fallout 4 and Fallout 76 have blown up in popularity. Given that both games had been out for a while before the series, some long-time fans remained dedicated to them for years, while some lapsed players returned with renewed vigor. As there are many more eyeballs on the Fallout franchise lately, some fans have gotten into collecting merchandise. This includes one gamer finding the Vault Dweller's survival guide at a thrift store, others finding different versions of the Pip-boy, and some making creations of their own. One fan has discovered a life-sized Fallout 3 promotional Power Armor statue while exploring the Facebook Marketplace.

Reddit user Aroldhinio00 recently shared two screenshots of the Facebook Marketplace featuring a Fallout 3 Power Armor statue. According to the listing, the statue is composed of hollow fiberglass and is being offered for free. The Power Armor also holds a gun that can be removed if a fan prefers a more neutral look for the Fallout Brotherhood of Steel figure. One image shows the statue from the side, which highlights the T-45's helmet. The other screenshot shows the back of the detailed Power Armor statue where the Power Core would be inserted if it were the real deal. The listing states that only 200 of these figures were made in 2008 when Fallout 3 was released, and they may have decorated GameStop stores to boost hype for the Bethesda title.

Is This Fallout 3 Power Armor Free?

As confirmed by some Facebook Marketplace users, this free listing may not be completely free. Some sellers use the free price to entice prospective buyers to message them, adding a price to the item in response when they're asked about it. In contrast, huge household pieces like couches or TVs are sometimes listed as free due to the sellers' inability to transport them. This may be the case with the Fallout Power Armor promotional display given that it's 7 feet tall and 3 feet wide. As the Reddit user hasn't confirmed the price, it's unclear which is the case.

As Bethesda has confirmed that it's developing Fallout 5 , there may be even more impressive promotional items like this to come. While this is a Fallout 3 statue, Fallout 4 and Fallout 76 received their own marketing gear that took things a step further. With millions of people using Facebook Marketplace, this Fallout 3 statue may be ideal for some collectors.

item.title: Every Metroid Prime Game, Ranked
item.description:
Intergalactic bounty hunter Samus Aran took some time off after the events of Super Metroid , as Nintendo could not find a satisfactory way to bring her space-faring exploits to the N64. But, when it was finally time for Samus to return, Nintendo hired Retro Studios to develop Metroid Prime for the GameCube. It was unusual for Nintendo to license their property to other developers, but as games like Prime and The Minish Cap by Capcom have shown, the results tend to speak for themselves.

The Prime series showcased exactly how one should go about transitioning a 2D franchise into 3D, as it retained all the class, spirit, and integrity of the side-scrolling games while propelling them into a new dimension. Over the twenty-plus years that have passed since Metroid Prime was first released in 2002, it has spawned several sequels, spin-offs, and a fourth entry that is slated to launch on Nintendo Switch in 2025.

7 Metroid Prime Pinball

DS Title Is A Competent Pinball Game And Not Much Else

  • Platform: DS
  • Developer: Fuse Games
  • Release Date: October 24, 2005
  • Genre : Pinball

The Prime brand was fairly popular in the aftermath of the first game's release in 2002, and the fact that one of Samus' most iconic abilities is being able to turn into a ball was perhaps too good to pass up, as Nintendo launched this underwhelming pinball game for the DS in 2005. Metroid Prime Pinball was conceived during the development of Metroid Prime Hunters , and they pitched the idea to Fuse Games, who had previously made Mario Pinball Land .

Metroid Prime Pinball isn't an entirely awful game — it's a competent pinball game on a platform that is a nifty fit for this type of experience. The boards look rather nice, and the connection of Samus' Morph Ball ability within the confines of a pinball machine is fun, but it's ultimately a novelty title that has remained largely forgotten as the Prime series released more titles.

6 Metroid Prime: Federation Force

Disappointing Co-Op Shooter Set In The Metroid Universe

During a time when fans were begging and pleading for a new Metroid game, Nintendo's response wasn't exactly what anyone was hoping for. Metroid Prime: Federation Force was announced at E3 2015 and launched on the 3DS a year later as a co-operative multiplayer shooter.

Unfortunately, Federation Force fell short of being either a fun Metroid game or an entertaining co-op shooter. It featured a harebrained plot and some questionable design choices — a shame, considering the prospect of a multiplayer shooter set in the Metroid universe is intriguing, but Federation Force didn't come close to achieving that promise.

5 Metroid Prime Hunters

Handheld Entry Keeps The Spirit Of Metroid Prime Alive On The DS

Metroid Prime Hunters was developed by an internal Nintendo studio, as Retro was busy with Echoes . Set between the events of Prime and Echoes , Hunters was as close as one could get to having this series on the go, and the finished product was rather impressive for a DS title.

Hunters also makes use of the stylus for aiming, while movement is controlled with the d-pad. It works most of the time, and the brisk pace of the game helps to make up for any incongruity in the control scheme. In terms of the two handheld Prime games, the other being 2016's Federation Force , Hunters was able to translate the home console nature of the franchise the best.

4 Metroid Prime

Samus Returns In Spectacular First Metroid Prime Title

After years out of the spotlight during the 1990s, Samus returned in fine form via Metroid Prime , a surefire GameCube classic that propelled the bounty hunter into superstar status. It's still one of the most impressive and innovative titles of its generation — and the first game to put players directly behind Samus' visor to enter full-blown first-person shooter territory.

But, what really made Prime special was how it deftly transferred the game mechanics from Samus' 2D exploits into 3D, as this first-person adventure game features a brilliantly interconnected map, outstanding combat, and a sense of discovery that is unmatched. The deeper exploration of the Chozo mythology is also perfectly handled, as it delves deeper into Samus' roots. Seeing loose elements from previous 2D entries brought together into something cohesive is absolutely marvelous.

3 Metroid Prime 3: Corruption

Spectacular Third Entry Sees Samus Face Off Against Her Dark Counterpart

While the first two Metroid Prime games found a home on the GameCube, the third entry was made for the Wii and took full advantage of the innovative control scheme on offer. In Metroid Prime 3: Corruption , the player makes use of the Wiimote in order to aim and fire, tapping into the potential of the console more than perhaps any other game in the library.

Corruption sees the events of the previous game, Echoes , come to fruition as Samus battles not only a Phazon infection but also goes up against Dark Samus, who she briefly battled at the end of the second chapter. This incredible third chapter of the Prime series is still worth playing today, as the precise aiming of the Wiimote meshes perfectly with the pristine map design and pitch-perfect combat.

2 Metroid Prime 2: Echoes

Outstanding Sequel Introduces Dark Samus

In the wake of Metroid Prime's incredible success, Nintendo tasked Retro with developing a direct sequel. Set an indeterminate amount of time after the first game, Metroid Prime 2: Echoes sees Samus embark on a dark journey on the planet Aether, where she crosses between the dark and light worlds in order to progress.

Echoes also sees some of Samus' usual weaponry swapped out for an arsenal focused on light and darkness, as they are core elements of the game's design. Additionally, Echoes features a fun multiplayer mode, the first in the series to do so, and it is absolutely worth playing today. The slick visuals, precise combat, and dark story all meld together brilliantly as Echoes is one of the GameCube's finest hours.

1 Metroid Prime Remastered

Incredible Remaster Of First Prime Game Is One Of The Switch's Greatest Titles

As the long, agonizing wait for Metroid Prime 4 continues, Nintendo sought to find a way to bring fans up to speed with the series and remastered the first game for the Switch in 2023. The end result was nothing short of perfection, as this astonishing GameCube title was rebuilt for the Switch and showed just how wonderful the game always was.

Metroid Prime Remastered maintains all the awe and wonder of the original game, featuring remarkable visuals and the same snappy combat system. It is a perfect fit for the Switch and looks incredible either docked or in handheld mode. It also introduces some nifty accessibility options, a slew of bonus content such as artwork and soundtrack gallery, as well as a reworked HUD. It is the best way to play one of the industry's finest games — and the best game to date in the Metroid Prime series.

item.title: 10 RPGs That Implement Survival Mechanics In Their Gameplay
item.description: RPGs have expanded into multiple sub-genres, developing their own niche that stands out among the others. One such example is the implementation of survival mechanics with RPG gameplay, creating immersive experiences that keep players on their toes.
